intro: Hebejeebie, commonly known as the New Zealand flower, is a genus of flowering plants native to New Zealand. It belongs to the plantain family, Plantaginaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of colorful blooms in shades of blue, purple, and white. Hebejeebie species are often cultivated in gardens for their ornamental value and adaptability to various soil types.
